snippet: Though there are no plans to build the Emo, the company says that the purely electric four-door runabout would meet federal safety requirements, have 100 miles of range and cost, if it were to enter production, $20,000.
abstract: Though there are no plans to build the Emo, the company says that the purely electric four-door runabout would meet federal safety requirements, have 100 miles of range and cost, if it were to enter production, $20,000.
lead_paragraph: The Tata Technologies electric mobility concept, or Emo, is a pure concept vehicle, with no clear path to production. So why was it built?

headline.main: Tata Technologies Readies a Conceptual E.V. for Detroit Auto Show
